title: Job Openings at Rated Cranes and Scaffolding Nigeria Limited
keyword: rated cranes and scaffolding nigeria limited
content:
At Rated Cranes and Scaffolding Nigeria Limited, we are Nigeria’s trusted partner in delivering world-class safety training, equipment services, and workforce solutions for the Oil & Gas, Manufacturing, Construction, and Industrial sectors. Our commitment to excellence, innovation, and safety ensures that your operations run smoothly, efficiently, and in full compliance with the highest industry standards.

We are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Quantity Surveyor (Business Development Officer)

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
Business Development & Client Engagement:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Serve as the primary liaison between the company and all clients (existing and potential)
	Actively pursue new project opportunities in Oil & Gas, Construction, and Industrial sectors


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Quantity Surveying, Building Technology, or a related field
	Minimum of 1-2 years of experience as a Quantity Surveyor or Estimator in Construction industries
	Must reside around Lekki Ajah axis.
	Proficiency in quantity surveying and estimating software tools
	Professional membership is an added advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@ratedcranesandscaffold.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Health Safety Environment (HSE) & Training Coordinator

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced HSE & Training Coordinator to lead and manage safety training activities and safety coordination projects at our Orofun, Ibeju-Lekki training center.
	The ideal candidate must reside within the Ibeju-Lekki axis and bring deep knowledge of marine, offshore/onshore safety practices with proven expertise in Confined Space Entry (CSE), Lockout Tagout (LOTO), and Fall Protection.


Key Responsibilities
Training & Instruction:


	Deliver hands-on and classroom training in: Confined Space Entry (CSE), Lockout/Tagout (LOTO), Fall Protection, Hot Work Permit Procedures
	Oversee training sessions for both staff and external clients ensuring compliance with international safety standards
	Update and review training materials, manuals, and procedures regularly


HSE Operations:


	Coordinate all safety-related programs and site supervision contracts
	Monitor compliance with applicable safety regulations on client construction sites and internal operations
	Conduct risk assessments and support implementation of corrective actions


Client Interface & Support:


	Serve as the primary safety training contact for current and prospective clients
	Collaborate with clients to design and deliver customized training and HSE programs
	Provide safety advisory and technical support for client projects and audits


Documentation & Compliance:


	Maintain detailed records of training, certifications and safety audits
	Ensure alignment with ISO 45001, 9001, 14001, and 14064 management systems 
	Support external and internal audits related to HSE and training programs


Required Qualifications and Certifications


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Environmental Science, Occupational Health & Safety, Engineering, or related field
	3–5 years of experience in marine, Construction, offshore, or onshore Oil & Gas operations
	Strong background in Confined Space Entry (CSE), LOTO, Fall Protection, Hot Work Procedures
	Professional Certifications (Mandatory):
	
		NEBOSH IGC, ISPON (Current Member)
		ASP/CSP (Board of Certified Safety Professionals)
		Membership in IIRSM, OSHA, or other recognized safety bodies
	
	
	Familiarity with relevant HSE software/tools and safety documentation systems
	Strong communication, instructional, and interpersonal skills
	Current Location: Lives within Ajah- Ibeju-Lekki axis


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@ratedcranesandscaffold.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Quantity Surveyor (Business Development Manager)

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
Business Development & Client Engagement:


	Serve as the primary liaison between the company and all clients (existing and potential)
	Actively pursue new project opportunities in Oil & Gas, Construction, and Industrial sectors
	Prepare and follow up on bids, EOIs, proposals, and commercial offers
	Respond to invitations to tender (ITTs), RFQs, and public procurement calls
	Build and maintain client relationships through email, calls, and meetings
	Promote Rated Cranes’ training and inspection services to new clients


Prepare accurate cost estimates for a wide range of services including:


	EPIC (Engineering, Procurement, Installation, and Commissioning)
	Technical Training Programs
	Safety Inspections and Third-Party Evaluations
	Crane and Equipment Repairs
	HVAC Design, Installation, and Maintenance
	Fire Detection and Suppression System Installations
	Scaffolding Erection and Working at Height Projects
	Lead the preparation of all tender documents including BOQs, technical write-ups, and commercial breakdowns
	Track and respond to all relevant published tenders and procurement notices
	Ensure timely submission of all documentation with appropriate follow-ups


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Quantity Surveying, Building Technology, or a related field
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience as a Quantity Surveyor or Estimator in Construction industries
	Proficiency in quantity surveying and estimating software tools
	Must reside around Lekki Ajah axis.


Must be a registered or active member of at least one of the following:


	Nigerian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (NIQS)
	Quantity Surveyors Registration Board of Nigeria (QSRBN)


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@ratedcranesandscaffold.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Secretary Job at Farm Katsina Limited
content:
The Farm Katsina Limited is an agricultural and flour mill comapny that deals in the livestock farming which includes cattle and poultry and maize flour production.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary
Job Location: Katsina
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a competent Executive Secretary to provide essential support to our high-ranking officials.
	You will play a crucial role in organizing and maintaining the executive’s schedule, as well as performing various administrative tasks.
	As an Executive Secretary, you must possess exceptional time-management and multitasking skills to handle multiple responsibilities efficiently.


Responsibilities


	Maintain executive’s agenda and assist in planning appointments, board meetings, conferences etc.
	Attend meetings and keep minutes
	Receive phone calls
	Handle and prioritize all outgoing or incoming correspondence (e-mail, letters, packages etc.)
	Make travel arrangements for executives.
	Handle confidential documents ensuring they remain secure
	Maintain electronic and paper records ensuring information is organized and easily accessible
	Prepare presentations or reports as assigned.


Requirements and Skills


	First Degree in Business Administration or relative field
	At least 5 years of proven experience as executive secretary or similar administrative role.
	Proficient in MS Office especially word, excel and powerpoint.
	In depth knowledge of office management and filing systems.
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills
	Outstanding communication and negotiation abilities
	Integrity and confidentiality.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and application letter to: thefarmsjob@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Fleet Officer Job at TAK Logistics Limited
content:
TAK Logistics Limited is a top-tier transportation firm based in Port Harcourt, offering unparalleled logistics solutions to our clients. Our expertise lies in efficiently transporting cargoes from production sites to storage facilities across Nigeria, ensuring a smooth and reliable delivery process every time.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer
Job Locations: Kaduna, Lagos and Rivers
Employment Type: Contract

Duties and Responsibilities
Operations:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage the loading and scheduling of loads
	Follow up with drivers for prompt delivery and return
	Manage diesel allocation for accuracy
	Confirm every delivery immediately after offloading to prevent losses and escalate every under delivery
	Report all diversion requests and follow up with prompt communication to the driver and clients
	Escalate all offloading delays for timely offloading
	OTD/TAT monitoring and management to ensure timely delivery and turnaround of the driver
	Maintenance delay reporting to clients in the overall improvement of our OTD score
	Embark on rescue operations where required.
	Preparation of reports such as daily final offloading point reporting and weekly final offloading point reports, amongst others.
	Support activities and other tasks as assigned by the team lead
	Monthly truck accessories reporting with a report to the management, including recommendations for drivers with missing accessories
	Manage the driver database and communicate the absence of drivers to the driver admin unit.
	Submit a well-compiled and up-to-date monthly active drivers’ list to the admin unit.


Asset Management:


	Work with new and previous drivers to take inventory of trucks and properly file such records.
	Supervise drivers during the process for a thorough execution and ensure the documents are well prepared.
	Conduct an inventory of accidented or abandoned vehicles at the incident scene, document and report accordingly.
	Ensure that the accessories of trucks under maintenance, accidented or without drivers are duly returned to the store.
	Any other task may be required


Requirements for Educational Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND with a minimum of 2 years of working experience as an Operations Assistant.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humanresources@ilsfleetmgt.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Female Sales Representative Job at Home Bargains Nigeria Limited
content:

Job Location: Wuse Zone 1, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a dynamic and customer-focused Sales Representative to join our retail team. If you have a passion for sales and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

	Maintain store cleanliness and product displays

N90,000 - N100,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: ad.homebargains@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: An aptitude test will be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
